verses.text: 欺貧重富必受懲罰撒瑪利亞山上的巴珊母牛啊！要聽這話；你們欺負貧窮人，壓迫窮苦人，又對自己的丈夫說：「拿酒來，給我們飲用。」

words.definition: oppress the poor and favor the rich
words.note: A literary idiom describing unjust treatment based on wealth.

verses.text: 主耶和華指著自己的聖潔起誓：「看哪！對付你們的日子快到，人必用鉤子把你們鉤走，最後一個也必被人用魚鉤鉤去。
你們一個一個經過城牆的破口出去，被丟棄在哈門。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: A place of exile or destruction mentioned in Amos 4:3.

verses.text: 向偶像獻祭的罪「你們去伯特利犯罪，在吉甲增加過犯吧！每早獻上你們的祭物，每三日獻上你們的十分之一吧！
以色列人哪！把有酵的餅作感謝祭獻上，高聲宣揚你們自願獻的祭吧！這原是你們喜愛行的。」這是主耶和華的宣告。
受重罰仍不悔改「雖然我使你們各城的人牙齒乾淨，各處都缺乏糧食；但你們仍不歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology: regret and change of heart.
Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 「我曾在收割前三個月，不降雨給你們；我降雨給一個城，在另一個城卻不降雨；我在一塊地降雨，另一塊地沒有雨水就枯乾了。
兩三個城的居民擠到一個城去找水喝，卻沒有足夠的水喝；但你們仍不歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 「我曾多次用熱風和霉爛擊打你們的園子和葡萄園，叫蝗蟲吃光你們的無花果樹和橄欖樹；但你們仍不歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree', referring to the fig's internal flowers.
Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 「我在你們中間降下瘟疫，正如臨到埃及的瘟疫一樣；我用刀殺掉你們的年輕人，你們被擄去的馬匹也遭殺戮；我使你們營裡死屍的臭氣撲鼻，但你們仍不歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Describes a strong smell, often unpleasant, that hits one directly.
Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 「我傾覆你們，就像傾覆所多瑪和蛾摩拉一樣；你們像一根木柴，從火裡抽出來；但你們仍不歸向我。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often used in the Bible for divine judgment
Often used in the Bible for divine judgment

words.definition: measure word for long, thin objects

words.note: Often used as a locative suffix
A verb-complement construction indicating direction
Often used for returning to God
The divine name of God in the Old Testament

verses.text: 「因此，以色列啊！我必這樣對付你。以色列啊！因我必這樣對付你，你應當預備迎見你的 神。」

words.note: Often used for meeting a respected person or God
Refers to the Creator God, often reverently offset in Chinese Bibles

verses.text: 看哪！他造了山，創造了風，把他的心意告訴人；他造了晨光和黑暗，他的腳踏在地的高處，耶和華萬軍的 神就是他的名。

words.note: Used to draw attention, common in biblical texts

words.definition: to tread, to set foot on
words.note: Verb-object compound, often describes walking or stepping
Often refers to hills or mountains, sometimes symbolic
The divine name of God in the Old Testament
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' or 'God of Armies'
Refers to the Creator God, often reverently offset in Chinese Bibles
